column4: could this be because Realplayer for Linux doesn't have an EQ ?
i was trying to show off linux to my girlfriend but failed w/ that one
or is it more dependant on the speaker system?
I bought a Logitech 2.1 system 32Watts RMS they sound excellent, i really want to get the same sound from plugging them into my linxu box
so to fix this problem maybe i need a better sound card that linux has decent drivers built into the kernel?
i used the same 2.1 setup, 2 satellites and 1 sub
and it sounds way better on the windows machine
i'll have to try it again later
i should try using xmms and a CD so i can play w/ a EQ
is xmms pretty much what everyone uses on ubuntu for playing cd's, mp3, ogg's, etc..??
if you use gnome you'd probably like beep-media-player better
yeah i use gnome now.
ubuntu converted me back to it
well I still like debian better
the new gnome kinda syx in some places
like the applications menu
im not setup to the universe. so i can't apt-get it. if i setup to the universe doesn't that mean i won't get security updates for programs i get from it?
in regards to that media player
I am not really sure where the player was but if you add universe I don't think there are any security updates for it
yeah i think i'll pass on that then.
but you don't really need security updates for pkg from universe as long as you update the versions
why not any for xmms?
k thanks.
